pandaEditor.nodes.constants module¶

pandaEditor.nodes.lensnode module¶

class pandaEditor.nodes.lensnode.LensNode[source]¶

Bases: object

on_select()[source]¶

Selection handler. Make sure to disable the frustum if it was shown before running the select handler as the frustum will change the size of the bounding box.

show_frustrum¶
pandaEditor.nodes.lensnode.get_frustrum(data)[source]¶

Return True if the lens node’s frustum is visible, False otherwise.

pandaEditor.nodes.lensnode.set_frustrum(data, value)[source]¶

Set the camera’s frustum to be visible. Ensure it is tagged for removal and also so it doesn’t appear in any of the scene graph panels.

class pandaEditor.nodes.nodepath.NodePath[source]¶

Bases: object

property children¶

Return a list of wrappers for the children of this NodePath, ignoring those NodePaths tagged with TAG_IGNORE (like editor only geometry).

If this node is a child of a model root, make sure to add its position in the hierarchy to the attrib dictionary.

pickable = True¶

property savable¶
scale¶
serialise_descendants = True¶
classmethod set_editor_geometry(geo)[source]¶

Set the indicated geometry to be used as a proxy for the NodePath. Tag all descendant NodePaths with the ignore tag so they don’t show up in the scene graph and cannot be selected.
